intro: Macrolobium retusum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on trees or rocks in humid environments. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. The plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
